channel.title: NullS!
channel.description: The god frickin nulls keep attacking my server, i have pvp server source, can someone help with the nulls?

item.title: NullS!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

2hnderspeckr:

i got pvp scape, im not havin problems

The only way you can is if you intentionally sign up on the status trackers. Even then you should be able to easily pick out the IP of these trackers and add it to the nulls.txt file or the bannedips.txt file. =\ Either works.

Read full topic

item.title: NullS!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:1, topic:52377”][quote author=lothy link=topic=73036.msg829441#msg829441 date=1169918839]

Or you can add AntiNull.java << what I have done and it worked perfectly…

^^
btw the AntiNull.java is not released I believe silab made one. But i never seen hers.

^^
That AntiNull.java is mine.

My source comes with one that automatically adds people’s IP addresses to a list if they connect more then 3 times in 5 seconds, and once they’re on that list the socket is immediately closed for any more connection attempts that IP makes. It doesn’t get better then that; so he’s either put his IP on a status tracker, or if someone is intentionally attacking his server they’re doing it very slowly.

Mine handles all unhandled packets [NULLS] and blocks them. [THIS PREVENTS LAGG]
^^
NullHandler does that

That uses a text file. Where I put the ip address / nearly the same as bannedips.dat but more efficent. Preventing the server from lagging. I am may release this in near future because I “quit” coding since i am rejected on rune-server, runesoft and this is my only place left. And since I see more leeching I have doughts of the release

I wouldn’t worry about other sites - they’re not much better.
Gander gets PMS every now and then, and even felt the need to take the domain. Not to mention he released the password database for Rs-server how many times?
I wouldn’t want to really be a part of anything he ran to be honest.

To be honest, all of the private server places are shit.

And my little add-on completely blocks the null’s connection attempt all together. It doesn’t even establish a connection that lasts for more then an instant.
[/quote]

But that connection is all that is needed. The PTP protocall between the gateways forms a kind of channel, which until dropped can’t be reconnected[/quote]
You can’t handle a null at all if there is no connection. My thing doesn’t establish the connection at all - I don’t think it can get any better then that. =\

Read full topic

My source comes with one that automatically adds people’s IP addresses to a list if they connect more then 3 times in 5 seconds, and once they’re on that list the socket is immediately closed for any more connection attempts that IP makes. It doesn’t get better then that; so he’s either put his IP on a status tracker, or if someone is intentionally attacking his server they’re doing it very slowly.

I am may release this in near future because I “quit” coding since i am rejected on rune-server, runesoft and this is my only place left. And since I see more leeching I have doughts of the release[/quote]

Gander gets PMS every now and then, and even felt the need to take the domain. Not to mention he released the password database for Rs-server how many times?
I wouldn’t want to really be a part of anything he ran to be honest.

To be honest, all of the private server places are shit.

And my little add-on completely blocks the null’s connection attempt all together. It doesn’t even establish a connection that lasts for more then an instant.

item.title: NullS!
item.dc:creator: @boomer216 boomer216
item.description:
@boomer216 wrote:

Nulls = Fact of Private Servers
Some Noobs who can’t make private servers attack servers so the owners are miserable and end up having to make their players use a client with a hidden IP and port so they can’t get attacked easy.
